14 Gregory Hall
Urbaria, Illinois
November 26, 1956
Mr. James S. Miles
Director, WBAA
Purdue University
Lafayette, Indiana
Dear Jim:
The NAEB position regarding APBE is that
whatever APBE does is ok with us. The primary concern
of that association is with the teaching of radio and
television. I don’t see that it conflicts with NAEB.
Leo Martin holds a similar view. Many APBE members
are directly or indirectly members of NAEB.
The University of Illinois was a charter
member of UAPRE - the predecessor of APBE. In fact,
Schooley attended the originating meetings. The early
impetus came from guys like Rus Porter and similar
Individuals.
APBE is backed pretty much by the industry,
especially UARTB which has $5,000 annually in its budget
to support the organization and its Journal.
I haven’t seen the APBE Quarterly but here
again I don’t see that it would bother us. Leo and I
have discussed this and Just didn’t find any conflicts
of interest.
To get down to the matter, I think it depends
on how much teaching of radio-television is done at
Purdue and whether or not Purdue wishes to be associated
with the organized group which has standards of instruction
(not accrediting) as its primary concern. I honestly
believe that what APBE amounts to only time will tell.
Sincerely,
FES:frah
Frank E. Schooley
President
